body: $ZIM interesting close. She was doing well 20-30 mins out then ten minutes out she was still green but began to fall quickly high showed a lack of conviction but 2 minutes out that reversed in a mad scramble which pushed it back up again to close over 1% and increased with after hours. I saw two orders fill 2and 3% higher in the fading seconds as well. So overall pretty good and 3 times higher than the market performed today. We don‚Äôt need big swings just yet as we repair the technical damage and we don‚Äôt need to attract the day traders. Nice easy grind to $65 would be nice before the acceleration.

body: Bruce Whitfield interviews the Cargo Compass CEO on The Money Show.
We've come through a very difficult time with Covid... We were certainly hoping that this year we would start to see it ease off but in fact it has not eased off.
We've seen that the congestion and delays are continuously growing... Transit times to SA from Europe
created_at: the USA and China are continuously rising...

body: Shipping lines are also increasing freight rates to the point where it impacts the consumer.
Importers are paying more to get goods to our shores; in fact the costs have skyrocketed he says.
Two years ago the basic Shanghai to Durban or Cape Town [12-metre container cost] would have been in the region of $2
column3: quite a decent price. Today we are facing

body: The big surprise for Q2 will be increased volume and rate efficiency caused by the Russian invasion of Ukraine.  A significant amount of cargo used to go from Asia to Europe through Russia.  Since Russia has been sanctioned
created_at: all of this cargo has been diverted to sea freight.  Zim's vessels have been sailing at faster speeds
column3: and working at breakneck paces in loading and unloading to keep up with this increase in demand in Q2.  The war will likely continue (at least through the end of Q2 - June 30) and on their May conference call (when they announce record Q1 results and a large dividend) they will also provide impressive guidance for Q2.
